oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Disciples of Christ Historical House, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1958, Vol. 2 p122
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the exterior of the Disciples of Christ Historical Society building,located at 1101 19th Avenue South, July 1958. Founded in 1941 as a service agency of the Christian Churches, the Historical Society 's purpose was to maintain and further interest in the religious heritage, background, origins, development, and general history of Disciples of Christ, Christian Churches, Churches of Christ, and other related groups. Taken by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1958. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
